paper_metadata.title: Renal Involvement in Hereditary Transthyretin Amyloidosis: An Italian Single-Centre Experience
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv) with kidney involvement

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Indeed, in one Val30Met patient a nephrotic syndrome represented the first sign of ATTRv.
At baseline, only two patients presented low eGFR (one Val30Met and one Phe64Leu); during follow-up, an additional 5 cases developed low eGFR.
Conversely, abnormal UPE was found in 4 Val30Met patients, 3 Phe64Leu and 3 with other single mutations.

functional_data.summary: Kidney involvement is common in ATTRv, with abnormal urinary protein excretion being a notable feature.

variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the prevalence of kidney involvement in ATTRv patients, particularly in those with the Val30Met variant.
key_quotes: Kidney involvement is quite common in patients with ATTRv regardless of the underlying genetic variant.
The presence of kidney involvement was high: low eGFR during any time of follow-up was present in 7 patients (15%), abnormal UPE in 10 (22% of the sample, 63% of those with available urinary data).

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text, focusing on the TTR gene variants.
